question: According to Christopher Hood, the new public management has how many number of goals or objectives?
explanation:
According to Christopher Hood, the new public management has the following Seven goals which are as follows-
1. Emphasis on professional management in the public sector
2. Laying of explicit standards and measures of performance
3. A shift to greater emphasis on output controls
4. Disaggregation of units in public sector
5. Competition in public sector
6. Stress on private sector management practices
7. Stress on greater discipline
